node.title: CBS News finds evidence of atrocities near Ukraine's capital
node.description: Russia claims images of a massacre in the town of Bucha are "fake." But a CBS News team went and saw firsthand strong evidence of war crimes.

node.title: Ohio lawmakers introduce bill similar to Florida's "Don't Say Gay" bill
node.description: "Curriculum about gender identity and sexuality has no place in K-3 classrooms, period," the bill's sponsor said.

node.title: Burger King sued by customers who claim Whoppers are too small
node.description: A class-action lawsuit alleges that ads inflate the Whopper's size, making the burger appear 35% bigger than it actually is.

node.title: Warriors keep the spine the same
node.description: Warriors sweat on fitness of captain ahead of round five clash with the Cowboys.

node.title: Golf fans eager to see Tiger Woods play again
node.description: Tigermania returned to Augusta National Golf Course in full force today as a cagey Tiger Woods kept the golf world guessing on whether he will be in this week's Masters field.

node.title: Zelenskyy tells U.N. Russia is "deliberately destroying Ukrainian cities"
node.description: Ukraine's president warned the world had yet to see the full scale of Russia's atrocities, and he said if the U.N. fails to stop the onslaught, it will become obsolete.

node.title: Harvard students help Ukrainians fleeing violence find housing
node.description: "We have hosts in almost any country you can imagine," said Marco Burstein, co-creator with Avi Schiffman of Ukraine Take Shelter.

node.title: Tiger Woods: "I feel like I'm going to play" the Masters
node.description: The 5-time champion at Augusta National who was inducted into the Golf Hall of Fame last month made the announcement Tuesday morning.

node.title: Proud Boys leader pleads not guilty to conspiracy related to Jan. 6
node.description: Enrique Tarrio indicated he would fight multiple high-level charges, including conspiring to assault law enforcement officers at trial.

node.title: Congressman who voted to impeach Trump announces retirement
node.description: The Michigan Republican said on the House floor that he will not seek a 19th term in Congress.

node.title: Elon Musk joins Twitter's board after becoming its largest shareholder
node.description: The Tesla CEO — and Twitter power user — is expected to press the company's CEOs on content moderation and free speech.

node.title: Ivanka Trump set to appear before January 6 committee
node.description: Her planned appearance comes less than a week after her husband, Jared Kushner, appeared voluntarily before the committee for several hours.

node.title: Police investigate hazing allegations involving women's rugby team
node.description: One person told police she had been "branded" using pliers and a lighter by other members of the rugby team.

node.title: 2nd man arrested in Sacramento mass shooting that left 6 dead
node.description: Police say Smiley Martin is the brother of the first suspect, 26-year-old Dandrae Martin. Neither has been accused of homicide.

node.title: Many Americans reluctant to discuss pot use despite legalization
node.description: It turns out that laws can change in an instant, but worries about being stereotyped are a lot harder to shake.

node.title: Watch Live: Ukraine's Zelenskyy to address U.N. over war atrocities
node.description: The president will address the U.N.'s most powerful body amid fast-mounting evidence - dismissed as "fake" by Russia - that Putin's forces purposely killed civilians.

node.title: Darwin notebooks missing for 2 decades returned — with a message
node.description: Authorities had launched an international hunt for the notebooks, which are valued at millions of dollars.

node.title: Low pay, grueling work fuels trucker shortage
node.description: Biden administration wants to recruit more women and veterans to the trucking industry as shortages persist.

node.title: Sacramento shooting suspect has history of violent crime
node.description: Police think there were several shooters but the only person in custody so far in the complex investigation isn't charged with homicide.

node.title: Man honored for saving 73-year-old woman from alligator attack
node.description: The medal is given to "those who enter extreme danger while saving or attempting to save the lives of others."

node.title: California may empower citizens to sue over illegal firearms
node.description: The bill is patterned after a similar Texas law​ allowing citizens to go after those who provide or assist in providing abortions.

node.title: Woman convicted of murder 3 decades after baby found dead on road
node.description: Authorities said the baby was dumped in woods in a garbage bag and that animals had mutilated the body and dragged it onto the roadway.

node.title: China extends Shanghai lockdown as COVID spreads despite draconian policy
node.description: Frustration is mounting in China's biggest city, but authorities say their controversial "zero-COVID" policy "will continue to guide the country's epidemic control."

node.title: What are war crimes and could Putin be prosecuted for them?
node.description: President Biden and his Ukrainian counterpart say Russia and its leader are guilty of war crimes. Here's what that means.

node.title: NZ-Ukraine visa: Choosing between safety and your family
node.description: Ukrainians trying to flee to New Zealand under a family reunification visa are being told they can come, but they will have to leave their relatives behind.

node.title: Romance novelist goes on trial in killing of her chef husband
node.description: Daniel Brophy was killed as he prepped for work at the Oregon Culinary Institute in Southwest Portland around 7:30 a.m. on June 2, 2018.

node.title: Secure 2.0: Here are 5 ways it could impact your retirement
node.description: The bipartisan bill could solve some savings gaps facing workers at a time when many Americans are unprepared for retirement.

node.title: Indonesian principal sentenced to death for raping at least 13 girls
node.description: Herry Wirawan was accused of raping girls between 11 and 14  from 2016 to 2021 at the school, hotels or rented apartments in the city of West Java. At least nine babies reportedly were born as a result of the rapes.

node.title: Biden administration aims to fix "family glitch" in health care law
node.description: The proposed fix would help 200,000 uninsured people gain health care coverage, according to the Biden administration.

node.title: Auckland water bills going up 7% from July
node.description: Inflation and Covid-19 being blamed - and with the price for 1000L of water will go up by about 12 cents, households with average water use will pay about $1.50 more a week.
